title: Critical-period threshold in swarm belief correction
hypothesis: Belief correction rate drops non-linearly above a proxy-K threshold (language critical-period analog)
method: Retrospective: 16 correction events from SESSION-LOG.md mapped to interpolated proxy-K; grouped into 3 K-bands

results.partial_recovery: high-K organic rate 0.21 (15% of low-K) — compaction + periodic scaffolding enables partial correction

conclusion: PARTIAL CONFIRMED. Organic correction rate drops 100% entering mid-K zone (27-40k), then partially recovers in high-K zone via periodic-audit scaffolding (0.21/10s). Critical period analog: K≈27k is the threshold where correction mechanism shifts qualitatively. Below: spontaneous discovery. Above: requires external trigger (periodic audit). Compaction events may reset the clock (K-floor descent = correction window re-open).
limitations: proxy-K interpolated not measured at each session
bootstrap confound: early sessions had more novel beliefs
open: (1) Forward-track organic vs triggered correction from S312
(2) Test: does compaction event re-open organic correction window?
(3) Measure correction quality (CONFIRMED vs REFINED ratio) above/below threshold
